attributes.comment:
To Whom This May Concern,

I am voicing my concern and complaint regarding the proposed increase in USCIS
applications.

I am in the first phase of my adoption from China. Due to the lenghthy process
that it takes China to complete an adoption (at present it is 18 months approx.),
those adopting are now being required to reapply for their I600A and other
documentation as we approach the 17 month mark.

The cost of the USCIS application is already a significant cost to us adopting and
because it only is valid for 18 months, most people adopting from China can
anticipate having to reapply their I600A. With the new proposal increasing the
price, I ask that the price either not be increased, since this will be a significant
cost to those already trying to scrape together the $13,000+ it cost to adopt, or
that those adopting be able to renew their I600A for 0 costs or at a reduced cost.

Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt when adoptions
took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140% and we receive with no increase in
services or a speedier turn-around.

And that's not even taking into consideration the fact that applying for our
children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to
$460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, we don't even
get the certificates for a year after filing!

Thank you for hearing my concern/complaint and I appreciate your consideration.
With such increased costs, many children will not be able to be adopted from
China and other countries that take longer than 18 months to complete an
adoption.

Oh, and by the way, my experience at the immigration office in Yakima was a
very postive experience. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. I think
they did an amazing job and represent our government very well.

Frances M Zembal
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Frances Zemball
